How Radon Mitigation Works

Radon mitigation systems use proven technology to reduce radon levels by up to 99%. Our systems create negative pressure beneath your home's foundation, preventing radon from entering your living space.

Active Soil Depressurization

The most effective method for reducing radon levels in homes with basements or crawl spaces.

Continuous Operation

Systems run 24/7 with minimal energy consumption, providing constant protection.

Proven Results

EPA-approved methods with documented success rates exceeding 90% reduction.

Mitigation System Components

1

Suction Point

Installed beneath foundation slab

2

PVC Piping

Routes radon gas safely outside

3

Radon Fan

Creates suction to draw out radon

4

Exhaust Point

Safely vents radon above roofline

5

Monitoring System

Ensures system is working properly

Mitigation System Types

We install the right system for your home's specific foundation type and construction.

Sub-Slab Depressurization

Best for: Homes with basement or slab-on-grade foundations

How it works: Creates suction beneath the concrete slab to prevent radon entry

Effectiveness: 90-99% reduction in radon levels

  • Most common and effective method
  • Minimal disruption to living space
  • Low operating costs
  • Proven long-term reliability

Crawl Space Ventilation

Best for: Homes with crawl space foundations

How it works: Increases air circulation to dilute and remove radon

Effectiveness: 70-90% reduction in radon levels

  • Natural or mechanical ventilation
  • Sealing of crawl space floor
  • Climate considerations important
  • May require moisture control

Block Wall Suction

Best for: Homes with hollow concrete block foundations

How it works: Draws radon from hollow spaces in block walls

Effectiveness: 80-95% reduction in radon levels

  • Targets radon in wall cavities
  • May combine with sub-slab system
  • Requires careful sealing
  • Custom design for each home
